p: Despite technological advances in medicine, communicable diseases are the greatest disease threat facing humankind. Diseases previously considered eradicated are reemerging, as new viruses and devastating communicable diseases such as Ebola, Zika, and dengue continue to surface and ravage humankind. Increased human population and accelerated global travel make local outbreaks instant global threats. Researchers are concerned that an avian influenza outbreak could kill many more people when it emerges because of the absence of immunity and human travel interaction patterns. Even more troubling antibiotic drug resistance is becoming more widespread.
